result.execSummary:
The defendant Amanda Beth Nolden was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fail/Report to County Jail (10 Days +), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.425(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amanda Beth Nolden

records.addlTxt:
01:47 PM Defendant Amanda Beth Nolden in court with attorney Annie E Getsinger.  Defendant Amanda Beth Nolden in custody.  Gabriel David Arevalo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states cases and appearances.  Atty Getsinger states all matters are resolved and state the agreement noting DE will waive her prelim in each felony matter and proceed to plea/sent today.  Court questions DE on waivers of prelim in 22CF72 and 22CF73.  DE agrees to waive her right to prelim in each matter.  Court accepts prelim waiver/finds probable cause/binds DE over.  Atty Getsinger acknowledges rec. informations in 22CF72 and 22CF73 and waives readings and stands mute.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties and enters NG pleas.  State states the joint recommendations.  Atty Getsinger agrees and she and DE plead NC to the agreed charges.  Court questions DE on pleas/accepts/finds DE guilty.  Court advises DE re: voting rights and felony firearms warnings.  State makes statement on behalf of the agreement and notes victim notification requirements met and nothing to provide the Court other than the restitution stipulation.  Atty Getsinger makes statement on behalf of the DE.  Court admonishes DE and sentences.

21CM219
Ct 1:  NC
30 days jail w/huber consecutive to 22CF73 and any other sentences - 4 days credit to be applied
$453.00 costs/surcharges to be paid to Clerk of Courts Office w/in 60 days or set up payment plan
DNA sample to be provided
Restitution/surcharges per stipulation to be paid to Clerk of Courts Office w/in 60 days or set up payment plan
Ct 2:  Dismissed/read-in
Ct 3:  Dismissed/read-in
Ct 4:  Dismissed/read-in

22CF72
Ct 1:  NC
24 months probation 
$518.00 costs/surcharges to be paid to Clerk of Courts Office w/in 60 days or set up payment plan
DNA sample to be provided
Conditions of probation:
AODA and follow through w/recommended treatment/counseling
Absolute sobriety at all times from alcohol and controlled substances
Agent to be notified w/in 24 hours if a prescription is received
Not to possess any controlled substances w/o a valid prescription
If a prescription is received the DE must maintain it in it's original bottle showing the DE's name, the name of the substance and the name of the doctor who prescribed it.
Random UA's per agent
Ct 2:  Dismissed/read-in
Ct 3:  Dismissed/read-in
Ct 4:  Dismissed/read-in

22CF73
Ct 1:  NC
30 days jail w/huber - to commence FORTHWITH - consecutive to any other sentences - 23 days credit to be applied
$518.00 costs/surcharges to be paid to Clerk of Courts Office w/in 60 days or set up payment plan
DNA sample to be provided

02:53 PM Defendant Amanda Beth Nolden in court with attorney Annie E Getsinger.  Defendant Amanda Beth Nolden in custody.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amanda Beth Nolden appeared by video means with Attorney.  Court states cases and appearances.  Defendant received and waives reading of complaints in 22CF72 and 22CF73.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties in those 2 cases.  DE advised of right to counsel.  Atty Getsinger has no record to make re: nonappearance in 21CM219.  State makes bail argument.  Atty Getsinger responds.  Court sets bonds.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearings in 22CF72 and 22CF73.

Plea/sent on 3/28/2022 at 1pm
